content.text:
Afirmative:
Might is used to talk about actions that are very likely to happen. There is an 80% probability.
Eg.Might He might be taking an extra math class next period, he needs to approve

May has less probality of the action happening. It's only a 40% opportunity.
May: I may go to Mr. Browns class next week, but I'm not sure that I can arrive on time.

Can helps us talk about our abilities.
Can: Magda can do the drawings for the project, she's very good at it.

Using could we can ask for permission or suggestions.
Could: Could you come during your recess to read a book from the library?
